intro: Quassia silvestris, commonly known as wild quassia, is a small evergreen tree native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Simaroubaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by elongated, woody fruits containing several seeds.
